intro: Jaltomata aypatensis, commonly known as the Aypatén wild tomato, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of bright yellow flowers. Its fruits are typically small, red or orange berries that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
